header.title: disksup

description.p: disksup is a process that supervises the available disk space in the system. It is available for Unix and Windows.
disksup periodically checks the disks. For each disk or partition that uses more than a certain amount of the available space, the alarm {{disk_almost_full, MountedOn}, []} is set.

item.p: All (locally) mounted disks are checked, including the swap disk if it is present.
All logical drives of type "FIXED_DISK" are checked.

description.p:
Alarms are reported to the SASL alarm handler, see
sasl:alarm_handler(3). To set an alarm, alarm_handler:set_alarm(Alarm) is called, where Alarm is the alarm specified above.
The alarms are cleared automatically when the alarm cause is no longer valid.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: The following configuration parameters can be used to change the default values for time interval and threshold:

item.p: The time interval, in minutes, for the periodic disk space check. Defaults to 30 minutes.
The threshold, in percentage of the total disk space, for how much the disk can be utilized before the disk_almost_full alarm is set. Defaults to 0.80 (80%).

Specifies whether the disksup helper process is to use POSIX conformant commands (true) only. Defaults to false. Setting this parameter to true can be necessary on embedded systems with stripped-down versions of Unix tools like df. The returned disk data and alarms can be different when using this option.
The parameter is ignored on platforms that are known to be POSIX incompatible (Windows and SunOS).

section.p: For information about how to change the value of configuration parameters, see kernel:config(4).

func.name: get_almost_full_threshold() -> Percent
func.fsummary: Get threshold, in percent, for disk space utilization.

desc.p: Returns the threshold, in percent, for disk space utilization.

func.name: get_check_interval() -> MS
func.fsummary: Get time interval, in milliseconds, for the periodic disk space check.

desc.p: Returns the time interval, in milliseconds, for the periodic disk space check.

func.name: get_disk_data() -> [DiskData]
func.fsummary: Get data for the disks in the system.

desc.p: Returns the result of the latest disk check. Id is a string that identifies the disk or partition. KByte is the total size of the disk or partition in kbytes. Capacity is the percentage of disk space used.
The function is asynchronous in the sense that it does not invoke a disk check, but returns the latest available value.

func.name: set_almost_full_threshold(Float) -> ok
func.fsummary: Set threshold, as percentage represented by a float, for disk space utilization.

desc.p: Changes the threshold, specified as a float, for disk space utilization.

The change takes effect during the next disk space check and is non-persist. That is, if a process restart occurs, this value is forgotten and the default value is used. See section Configuration above.

func.name: set_check_interval(Minutes) -> ok
func.fsummary: Set time interval, in minutes, for the periodic disk space check.

desc.p: Changes the time interval, specified in minutes, for the periodic disk space check.

The change takes effect after the next disk space check and is non-persist. That is, if a process restart occurs, this value is forgotten and the default value is used. See section Configuration above.
